website_summaries.verdict: Chicago Metallic brand is built to last and produces delicious, evenly cooked popovers every time.
pros: Dark, non-stick steel produces perfect, airy popovers
Pan has a quality, weighted feel to it
Popovers come out with ease without the use of cooking spray
6-cup pan makes slightly larger popovers than the 12-cup option
cons: While it is dishwasher safe, hand washing is strongly recommended

customer_reviews.title: Coating peels off onto your food! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these pans in Nov 2015. I used them about 7 times and each time a bit more of the non stick coating peeled away onto the bottom and sides of my popovers. I have been very careful washing only with a sponge and regular liquid dish soap by hand, in the sink. According to Amazon I can no longer return them, even though it has been less than a year and they supposedly had a 25 year warranty. These were expensive pans and really should have held up much better. It is a shame because I was so very excited the first few uses because they made incredible tall, puffy popovers.
customer_reviews.author: xname

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these!!’
customer_reviews.text: The nonstick finish baked into the popovers and peeled off the pan. Had to throw out the popovers and the pans!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christina T. Pizzullo

customer_reviews.title: Beware of non-stick coating attached to popovers!
customer_reviews.text: This pan functioned well the most of the times it has been used. This weekend however, flakes of the non-stick coating started coming out of the pan on the popovers. While this was purchased late 2014, it has only been used 3 or 4 times a year. It appears that lifetime is about a dozen uses!
customer_reviews.author: David LaPlante

customer_reviews.title: Simply the absolute BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews on many sites regarding popover pans and settled on this company. I have other popover pans from other companies that simply did not produce the quality popover I was looking for. Chicago Metallic has NAILED IT!! The popovers are consistently perfect in every way. The cost is in middle range and one would assume the more expensive the better the out come. Not in this case! I can highly recommend their popover pans and plan to purchase more in different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: ewjlbj

customer_reviews.title: This pan will cut you with sharp metal edges everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Great pan that will cut your fingers to pieces!! This pan works great! Then you go to wash it and realize the six metal cups were never deburred and all have razor sharp edges. I cut the heck out of my finger. Wow. Talk about a lack of detail! Maybe if the razor edges were removed I could let my daughter help me bake. Let me know if you’d like to help me find a resolution because at this point I’m stuck with it and not very happy
customer_reviews.author: aaron schelbrack

customer_reviews.title: Works well BUT Be Careful!
customer_reviews.text: The pan works well, my popovers came out great however, the edges are sharp. I noticed it when I unpacked it. 1 week later I used it and forgot about those sharp edges. My pinky finger got a pretty good slice in it as I was greasing the pan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.text: The product claims to be dishwasher safe. But the first time I ran it through the dishwasher, it became drastically harder to remove the popovers cleanly. One more time through, and it is now impossible... IMPOSSIBLE no matter how much butter I grease it with to get any of the popovers out in one piece. I'm using a tried and true recipe that definitely worked perfectly with this product pre-dishwasher. Out of the return window now, so nothing to do. But this is false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Metal came off the pan and onto the popovers
customer_reviews.text: These worked fine for 3 years, but I just made a batch of popovers and the metal came off the pan and onto the popovers. Throwing them into the garbage
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: Cooks well, non-stick coating flakes off quickly
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pan for less than three months, cooked between a dozen or two batches with it. The pan cooks evenly and doesn't burn. The non-stick coating works pretty well. The huge caveat though is that the non-stick coating itself flakes off. One of the cups (the one with the wording on the bottom) started flaking coating off after less than a dozen uses. Other cups have followed. So now there's a bunch of holes. Plus, when the coating flakes off, it sticks into the dough so you have to be careful every time to look at the bottom. And then, of course, after the coating is gone enough, it is no longer non-stick...
customer_reviews.author: dmoy

customer_reviews.title: Always quality stuff from Chicago Metallic
customer_reviews.text: This popover pan is just what you need to bake tasty breakfast treats. Very non-stick surface releases the popovers easily after removing from the oven. A quick spritz with the sprayer at my kitchen sink and a wipe with a soapy sponge and a clean water rinse and it's ready to go again. Many of my professional cookware items are from Chicago Metallic and they are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Max H. Herr

customer_reviews.title: Popovers...flair plus.
customer_reviews.text: It's so easy to make popovers, and they look very impressive and sophisticated.. Follow the directions...precisely for best results. Heat it up before putting in the batter. That's very important. And I bought two for gifts. Recipients were thrilled and successful with their baking. Flour, milk, eggs, salt, butter. Heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend due to SHARP edges
customer_reviews.text: It has very sharp edge/area that when my husband picked it up one time, it gave him a very deep cut. Now it is just sitting on our kitchen cabinet. Do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rose H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pan!
customer_reviews.text: Totally awesome pan! The traditionally anchored individual cups insure even baking of each popover. The trick to easy popover release it to very lightly brush each cup with a high temp oil (grapeseed, avocado). Put the empty pan on a rimmed baking sheet and slide into the oven while the oven is coming to temperature. Remove the pan from the oven, pour in the batter and return to oven to bake. Popovers release every time! Use farm fresh eggs for super dramatic popovers.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have been making popovers forever (decades), and I finally wore out my old pan. Got this pan as a replacement and my tried and true batter doesn't rise in this pan. Don't know if it's something about the metal not conducting heat well enough, but I threw it away. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Erica S

customer_reviews.title: It works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm. First time making pop overs, but it was great. If i knew they had mini size, i would have totally ordered the mini size, just because it produces more.. but, i do not regret the quality at all. It sounds like the pan has to do a lot with the success of making the pop over right.. so, even though it was a little bit more than others, i thought it was worth investing. Easy to clean too!
customer_reviews.author: young mi cho

customer_reviews.title: Great Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: These baking dishes are very nice and easy to clean. I use baking cups sometimes. Nice quality. I have several of these and would recommend them. When I bake I want the right kind of tools so I always get the right items. Since these pans are darker I remove a little earlier because they tend to get a little darker than I like.
customer_reviews.author: awinters40

customer_reviews.title: Mmmmm Popovers!
customer_reviews.text: I love this popover pan. We make them for holidays and tea times. This is the best one I have found, and have also given it to my adult children, so that they can continue the tradition at their houses. I love the large pan with 6 wells. I haven't tried the 12 small ones, although that would be cute for tea time! The recipe that comes with it, is great! I like these better than Yorkshire Puddings (GASP!).
customer_reviews.author: HeartofAvalon

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: First time I had a popover was at a quaint country restaurant in Wisconsin and they were so good and unique I knew I would want to make them. This pan works great. Popovers are delicious, but really don't turn out well without the proper pan. My biggest issue was having a pan for only one use so in order to justify this purchase, I have also used the pan to make tall cupcakes, mini chicken pot pies and layered jello towers for the grandkids and anything else I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: L. Vandehey

customer_reviews.title: Great pan, great price
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to making some Stonewall Kitchens popovers from their mix. They came out great! This pan is perfect for really high, light, and airy popovers. The well is the right size and the nonstick surface is great. Even though I buttered the pan and the rims per the recipe I doubt that even if you did not do such a good job at buttering the pan that you would have any trouble with sticking as the nonstick coating just naturally prevents it. This pan is well constructed and I put it I. The dishwasher without any problems. I would not use any other pan for popovers.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Mystery Reader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Just opened mine and breathed a sigh of relief. I was worried that as some wrote they were “mini” and I was afraid they would be really small. They are the perfect size and appear very well made. Can’t wait to see my popovers “pop”. Hubby ate 4 when I put them in a cupcake pan and they looked like they were flat😂
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for popovers. Questionable manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this pan, and the smaller popover version we bought with it. We use it every couple of weeks. However, after about a year now, the tack welds on the back that keep the cups attached to the cross supports are starting to rust. Very very unhappy about that. For a year, I would have given these 4.5-5 stars. Love the popovers they clean reasonably easy for stamped out cups that you pour sticky dough into. But this rusting issue even though it is not in the food contact area, is not acceptable. I cannot recommend these even though I might like to, unless you can afford to replace them every year, which I cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: I make popovers every Christmas morning as part of our family tradition. I have purchased both the large set and now the smaller sized popover pans. THEY ARE AWESOME!!! No fail popovers every single time and no fuss clean up! I wish I had these 20 years ago but am happy I have them for the next 20!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy M.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Yorkshire pudding in these pans, so much better than muffin tins. The separation between cups lets the air flow, and bakes them so much better and higher. Well worth the money to have a beautiful Yorkshire or popover
customer_reviews.author: 2see

customer_reviews.title: Doing wonders for my popovers
customer_reviews.text: They are both fantastic. I have found that the popover size from the larger 6-cup pan ALWAYS feeds TWO people, so if the 12-cup is perfectly fine if you want to make more individual-sized popovers. Like others have said, very easy to clean and they have never sticked to the pan once. This may change with additional use over the years, but i'm sure this can be resolved with non-stick spray. For now, no spray or lubricant needed!
customer_reviews.author: Han Luke Peng Chen

customer_reviews.title: Good design and manufacture
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my Popover Pan that got rusted during a moving/storage situation. I have this pan, which makes12 small Popovers, and the larger 6-cup pan. Chicago Metallic remains good quality, well designed and manufactured. With care, it should last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Derringer

customer_reviews.title: Superior popover pan
customer_reviews.text: I love this popover pan so much I've bought them for my dad, big brother and lil sister. The popovers never stick and rise way better than a traditional muffin pan. Highly recommend this if you like fluffy popovers!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi B.

customer_reviews.title: Popovers are PERFECT and beautiful to look at as well as tasty
customer_reviews.text: Who knew a pan could make this big of a difference! Popovers are PERFECT and beautiful to look at as well as tasty. The muffin tin approach we used to use resulted in a very unappetizing, lopsided...thing which we promptly plopped a slab of prime rib over to hide it! With this pan, the popovers are proudly displayed beside the roast and get rave reviews from our guests. Like my dad always told me- "Use the right tool!" And this is absolutely the right tool for perfect popovers. (That and a great Pintrest recipe...!)
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: popover pan
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a five star but the pan is difficult to handle. Those thin rails make it difficult to move in and out of the oven. Other than that this pan works great. I have been cooking various recipies and even the failures are tasty. I have been brushing the cups with butter or fat and the popovers just pop right out. This is a nice pan to experiment with. I am going to try shrimp and asparagus filled tomorrow. Oh yeah, you can fill popovers; my favorite so far has been a prune in each cup. Anyway this is a fun little pan for experimenting.
customer_reviews.author: Drunken Duck

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should! Great for the holidays or having people over. A little smaller than I thought it would be, but does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect popover pan
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pan for popovers. I made them for Thanksgiving and my guest was so impressed with how easy it was to make the popovers, that she also bought the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard

customer_reviews.title: Great popover pan
customer_reviews.text: I tested this with a few recipes and the pan performed well. I have purchased several Chicago Metallic pans and they have not warped, discolored or stuck during any of my baking to-date.
customer_reviews.author: Martha H

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Great pop over pan! Didn't realize it was a mini when I bought it, but they come out awesome regardless! Always get the pan hot before you add your batter, your popovers will really pop over!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Dionne

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Popovers
customer_reviews.text: This makes much higher popovers than a muffin pan. Also the crust is firmer and coloring is more even. Very easy to clean. Since the closure of the popiver cafe I have had to make my own. I am considering a 6 cup one to make less in my toaster oven on convection setting.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Man on The Street

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy non stick baking container
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy non stick baking container. The size is perfect. Handling it is a little awkward. I wish it had a grip lip or something as it is rather odd to maneuver it with a oven mitten while hot.
customer_reviews.author: Olimpia Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: This made wonderful popovers on the first try. The batter didn't stick. I've tried making popovers before, but they have always failed. It was wonderful to have success on the first try.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Pan!
customer_reviews.text: I love to cook and the Popover Pan is a wonderful addition to my kitchen. I used the recipe for popovers which I found in Martha Stewart's Baking Handbook. This is a high quality piece of equipment. It produces great results and the popovers literally fall out of the pan. It has a non-stick finish but I always use a vegetable spray or butter. Another plus is that it is offered at a fair price. This pan will give you many happy years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Alice M. GroveTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect popovers!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect popovers every time. This pan is sturdy and non-stick. I recommend this pan to anyone that makes popovers on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: TillTuesday

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these a couple years ago and because everyone loves my popovers I needed another one so I can do two batches. This works great
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Aumand

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've been using muffin time for years, but finally have a proper pan to make Yorkies to go with any roast. So glad I finally got one. It was easy to clean, the Yorkies came up perfect and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother for Christmas and she loved it! Her old one was over ten, maybe twenty, years old and had A LOT of use (started to crack and get rusty). It was definitely time for a new one. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly [Even without Non Stick spray]
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this popover pan to make popovers at my mother in law's Thanksgiving. I was nervous about it because I'd never made popovers before, but this pan worked beautifully. I'm giving it five stars because - the recipe I had called for a non stick pan, but also said to spray the pan with non stick cooking spray before adding the batter. In the Thanksgiving rush, I forgot to do that and remembered halfway through the cooking time. I was picturing scraping ruined popovers out of the pan because of my mistake, but they fell right out, no prodding needed. They were just beautiful and perfectly baked.
customer_reviews.author: Journalist Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan.
customer_reviews.text: Built super tough. Turns out I’m not fond of plain popovers though, maybe with gravy yes. Still can use it for muffins.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Southard Purdue

customer_reviews.title: great but realize they are a mini
customer_reviews.text: These work very well but my husband, who ordered them, didn't realize they make mini popovers. They worked though and dinner guests were all delighted
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mainer

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: I have never made popovers and with the COVID-19 stay at home orders, my husband and I have been trying new foods and new cooking techniques - this pan is awesome! Popovers were delish! This pan is easy to use, sturdy and easy to clean! Can't wait to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: BBH

customer_reviews.title: Very shape edges
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not buy this. I was so excited to us this. Right out of the package while washing it, two cuts to my fingers. The edges on the middle cups are very very razor sharp. My husband tried to smooth them but they are very hard to get to. Went straight to the recycling bin! Such a shame
customer_reviews.author: lcab9611

customer_reviews.title: I cooked the popovers at the recommended temperature in my oven
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan at the beginning of January. In March, the metallic-colored coating on the pan came off on the popovers during cooking. I've used no strong or abrasive cleaning products or abrasive scrub pads on the pan. I cooked the popovers at the recommended temperature in my oven. Too bad because the popovers were light and puffy. My family wasn't into eating the surface coating.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Honig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Used it the day I got it for the best popovers EVER - they literally just popped out of the pan it was so easy!
customer_reviews.author: ditrying

customer_reviews.title: Better than a muffin tin.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. I make everything in it. Brownies, pound cake, muffins, etc... Nothing sticks to it and the shape is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Morris

customer_reviews.title: Just Like Jordan Pond House
customer_reviews.text: Ever since visiting Bar Harbor I had cravings for the amazing popovers that has made the Jordan Pond House such a popular restaurant. I had tried to make popovers in a regular muffin pan, but they would never turn out quite right. I found this pan on Amazon and ordered it hoping my popovers would improve, and boy did they ever! I have been making popovers for more than just Christmas and Thanksgiving holidays. The no-stick surface allows the popovers to slide out easily and they are light, fluffy, and HUGE! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Tami O

customer_reviews.title: My favorite purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pop over pan!!!! I have used it so many times and have experimented making ham and cheese pop overs and sweetened others with sugar on top before baking and enjoying them with Honey.... The pop overs never fail to satisfy!!! Best Purchase.. Five stars from Me. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mylene Lori Gartmann

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Makes wonderful popovers! The number of cups eliminates the need for several sizes. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joan S

customer_reviews.title: ... cast popover pan with this Chicago metallic and I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a heavy cast popover pan with this Chicago metallic and I LOVE IT !!!!! My popover cook so much better in this pan. I don't know if it is because they are a mini popover or a different type of pan, but I would never go back. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Paulatics

customer_reviews.title: Great concept for easy baking
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in April and by November non stick coating came off onto the bottom of a popover. Great concept for easy baking, but check the bottom of your popover before eating.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and great popovers
customer_reviews.text: Quality product and great results. Not much else to add. Arrived well packaged and brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Photogeek

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY POPOVER BAKING PAN - THE MINI
customer_reviews.text: The Chicago Metallic Non Stick Mini Popover Pan is great. Good quality. Each cup is spaced by the sturdy wire rack design so that the individual popover gets full, all around heat. This design of single cup cooking make excellent popovers as the heat flows to all sides on even the center popovers cup. I have been making the regular and the cheese popovers. Even the cheese mix does not stick to the pan and just fall out. Nothing stuck in the small cup that has to be dug out. Much better than my old method in a muffin type tins. I recommend this design and brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to I used it 2 times already and it does its job. Make sure to heat the pan before pouring the batter for good rise
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: This pan + Alton Brown's popover recipe = heaven
customer_reviews.text: Best popovers ever. One of the very few single purpose kitchen items I have and it's well worth tne extra space.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Brunges

customer_reviews.title: Makes amazing, delicious  popovers!
customer_reviews.text: This pan did a wonderful job of making gorgeous, light, airy popovers! The pan was preheated as recommended, and butter was added to the cups, before filling them 1/2 way with batter. The popovers rose to 3 times the size, and turned out beautifully, crusty on the outside, and soft, airy, and buttery on the inside. They were served with our Christmas dinner, and devoured quick by my family. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Annette H.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and clean up was so easy
customer_reviews.text: This popover pan is a life saver if you like making popovers, which I do. I have tried making them in muffin pans but they just aren't the same. I thought there was something wrong with the recipe or with me but, lo and behold, it was the pan. This popover pan makes a huge difference in the rise and browning of your popovers. I am very pleased with this pan and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ssp

customer_reviews.title: Happy to buy a second one
customer_reviews.text: My baker daughter had requested a second set so she could make two different kinds of popovers at the same time. Perform as expected. Price was ballpark with everyone else. Two day Prime delivery arrived as promised. No reason not to give highest rating.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Phillip

customer_reviews.title: A little went a long way!
customer_reviews.text: This pan was the best. It allowed me to make more popovers and smaller ones for those who are dieting. Using this pan and my other new six cup popover pan, allowed me to make more without sacrificing the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Rock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large popovers
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was expecting! Nice deep cups because I like BIG popovers. I put more batter in each cup so the popovers rise high above the pan. Just make sure you position your pan in the middle of the oven with lots of room on top. Also, I like the non-stick pan (as long as you butter them up before). Every time so far, the fragile popovers come out nice and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Slawson

customer_reviews.title: Chicago Metallic Popover pan
customer_reviews.text: Used to making yorkshire pudding, I wanted to try popovers (basically the same.) I chose this one because of the open wire framing which is suppose to raise them better due to air circulation. They were Tall and tasty. Popovers are best fresh as they lose their crust. I read reviews online and Chicago Metallic as rated the best for popover (and other) specialty pans.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hetue

customer_reviews.title: Just follow a good recipe, and let these pans bring perfection to your popovers
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't like popovers? With the several recipes I've tried, I recommend buying two of these pans so you can cook more per hour to keep up with the demand.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob1

customer_reviews.title: This is the best popover pan for the Hudsons popover recipe I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best popover pan for the Hudsons popover recipe I have perfected. I buy one pan a year- just like baking sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Honest1

customer_reviews.title: popovers are fun and easy to make with this tin
customer_reviews.text: popovers are fun and easy to make with this tin. yes you can use a regular cupcake tin, but this one gives you professional results. never fails to impress at dinner parties. very well constructed and super easy to clean on top rack of dishwasher. love love love it!!
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be afraid of popovers! This pans makes it easy to prepare! Family loves them! Solid and easy clean up!
customer_reviews.author: Todd panek

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pan
customer_reviews.text: Had one like this already but there were never enough popovers! Only used it once so far but seems to be as expected
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Popovers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a friend who wanted to know how to make Yorkshire Pudding. This is perfect, as it comes with the recipe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The key to great popovers and muffins
customer_reviews.text: Finally I am able to make those tall hollow pop-overs like a professional. After years of good and bad with my muffin tins, I invested in 2 of these pans. What a difference the pan makes! The pans nest together in my bakery tin closet so they don't take up a super about of space, but they are quite large. They clean like a breeze because they are non-stick inside and out. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Creative 1

customer_reviews.title: Really makes a difference!
customer_reviews.text: This popover pan really makes a noticable difference in the quality of our popovers.
customer_reviews.author: Shain

customer_reviews.title: Well made, works great
customer_reviews.text: Heavy gauge metal cups, good coating, good welds. Doesn’t bend in the oven. I’m sure I’ll have this one for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect popovers!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a popover newbie, and have done 8 batches now and every one of them has turned out absolutely perfect. The pans are heavy, sturdy, and marvelously non-stick. And making the popovers is far easier than I'd been lead to believe. I now find myself looking for reasons to make popovers!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Popovers rule!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I feel in love with popovers a couple years ago when we took a trip up to Bar Harbor, Maine. This pan allows us to recreate our favorite treat from that trip. We used the pan several times and it makes great popovers. It's a high quality item.
customer_reviews.author: VolbeatYou

customer_reviews.title: Must have for popovers
customer_reviews.text: Stop making popovers in a muffin tin - you need this pan instead. They are even better than before - and they were great before!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Masterson

customer_reviews.title: great pan
customer_reviews.text: very nice pan, to bad it can't make my popovers turn out better. I guess that is up to the cook
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect popovers every time !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I have owned many popover pans and this one by far bakes the highest popovers yet. Super easy to clean as well. The price is just an extra little bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Aandjsmom3

customer_reviews.title: Beware Sharp Edges
customer_reviews.text: The edges of the cups of this are so sharp that my adult daughter cut herself on it. Pan performs well, but be very careful of cheaply (un)finished edges!
customer_reviews.author: sssgcda

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to clean. The popovers I've made have been perfect--not too brown, no sticking problems, even cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Thomas A. Firey

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a popover pan here it is
customer_reviews.text: Very user friendly. Baked goods are easy to remove and a cinch to clean
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and definitely nonstick
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool baking pan. I've used it on Thanksgiving and Christmas to make my popovers. They came out perfect and were a hit at the dinner table.
customer_reviews.author: lori marshall

customer_reviews.title: Cup broke off
customer_reviews.text: Already had a cup break off. Pretty sure it came already starting to break.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this pan for a couple of months and really like it. I have been using cooking spray when making popovers and they come out beautifully. Clean up is great and I put it in the dishwasher without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: MNJAN

customer_reviews.title: If you want real "pop up" muffins.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this once and it worked perfectly. I even forgot to spray the pans first but no problem the muffins slid right out after they were done. I used the recipe from the Diners, Drive In and Dives TV show that uses gruyere cheese and they were liked by all who ate them.
customer_reviews.author: Courtda

customer_reviews.title: Made perfect popovers..
customer_reviews.text: Makes great popovers and the popovers slide ride out of the cups. The pans appear to be of good quality. Have only used a them a few times. Just a note: I ordered 2 pans, but unfortunately I can't quite fit both in my oven at the same time length-wise, due to the "framing" around the cups. They fit fine side-by-side, but the overhang keeps my oven door just slightly ajar. I baked them anyway as I was in a rush, they were okay, but not as "airy" as usual, due to some heat escaping.
customer_reviews.author: L.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: I just received and absolutely love it. I was debating on whether to get another reliable traditional pan but decided on this. I am glad I did. The size is bigger than I* thought --not mini - just smaller than the big traditional popovers.
customer_reviews.author: moondog

customer_reviews.title: Made very well!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about this pan because it was so inexpensive. But it’s great! Very sturdy and well made. Cleaning it also takes me just a couple of minutes. My popovers also come out of the pan very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no stars if i could
customer_reviews.text: awful. absolutely worthless. I've used them for a week and the popovers already stick like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Beth F.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Pan
customer_reviews.text: Chicago Metallic makes an endless line of quality products and this is no exception. Non-stick and open to circulation, these are wonderful baking pans. Don't forget rule one: if your recipe is no good the pan won't save it. So if you have a popover recipe that works for you it will work as well as you hope in this pan.
customer_reviews.author: CAS MARINO

customer_reviews.title: Popover Pan Nirvana
customer_reviews.text: Popovers are a family favorite since our trip to the Jordan Pond House in Bar Harbour, ME. The key to a great popover is a popover pan that easily releases the heavenly delights. I purchased this brand of popover pan at a local kitchen store. When, due to demand, I needed a second one I looked to Amazon for the best price. It was $3 cheaper than the local kitchen store, and with free shipping, I ordered three!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Busick

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A VERY NICE SIZE POPOVER. IT COOKED EVERY ONE OF THEM EVENLY AND GOLDEN IN COLOR, AND THEY FELL RIGHT OUT OF THE PAN. IT WAS SUPER EASY TO CLEAN . OVER ALL A VERY GOOD DEAL FOR THE MONEY. I MADE ADDITIONAL POPOVERS IN MY MUFFIN TIN AND ALTHOUGH THEY TURNED OUT WELL, IT DID NOT COMPARE TO THE HEIGHT AND LOOK OF THE NON STICK PAN.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Never made popovers before. These made them easy. I will be using them often.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Leonard R. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Best popover pot!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect popovers!! I just heat the pans, then rub a stick of butter quickly in each cup!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Fried

customer_reviews.title: Great Baking Pan
customer_reviews.text: My family enjoys popovers. They are so easy to make if you have the right pans to bake them in. The popover pan does a great job and the popovers get real large and crispy. The only problem is my family wants them every night. I told them I could not have that many calories every night. Also your popovers can be used for a sweet desert, or you can make them savory by adding a meat of your choice and some gravy.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila McElroy

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This pan makes really good mini-popovers. It is very easy to clean as nothing seems to want to stick to it. Butter the cups with melted butter and then wipe away the excess. Heat until very hot and pour in the batter about 1/2 full in each cup. The recipe I used produced only 11 popovers but each was light with a crispy top crust, and the characteristic hollow center.
customer_reviews.author: lola

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty pan!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't made any popovers yet. This pan is very heavy which is exactly what is needed to make popovers. It looks very durable since you have to make sure the pan is very hot before pouring in the batter or they don't rise properly. I would recommend this product. This item arrived as scheduled
customer_reviews.author: Laurie S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great quality
customer_reviews.text: It was great for making what I bought it for. Easy to use and it was made well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Best Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pan for a year now and it never fails. The coating has held up perfectly and it is the best constructed popover pan of the four I have had over time. Strongly recommend and great value.
customer_reviews.author: D. Alpert

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I've been making popovers in muffin tins my whole life. I just made my first batch in this, and WHAT a difference. Popovers are divine and super easy to make. I use Vincent Price's recipe which is easily accessible in your favorite search tool. Love this pan! The popovers turned out great. Golden brown and fluffy. Yum.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Del Sesto

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I made Yorkshire pudding and they worked perfectly! Previously I had made them in muffin pans which was less successful. The puddings puffed up wonderfully and as the heating was more disbursed than in the muffin tins, they didn't deflate when they came out of the oven. I read that this is generally caused by undercooking. Anyway, if you plan to make popovers or Yorkshire pudding, these pans are highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Chicago Metallic Professional 12-Cup Non-Stick Mini-Popover Pan, 16-Inch-by-10.75-Inch -
product_meta.description:
Size:12-CupTo create true popovers, this is the pan for you. The cups are designed so that as popovers bake, rise, and "pop over" just like in the bakery—they won't spread into the others in the pan. Deep tapered cups promote even baking and better air circulation. The pan is also great for making muffins and cornbread. Oven safe to 450°F / 232°C; not intended to be used under the broiler. Sharp-edged utensils and knives should not be used. 
At Chicago Metallic, we believe that serious baking requires serious bakeware. That’s why we’ve been crafting innovative equipment, for professionals and serious home bakers, for over 100 years. We’ve built a global reputation one kitchen at a time. People know our products are built for durability and can be depended on year after year. We’re proud to offer three distinct lines of premium bakeware plus stylish, innovative specialty bakeware and baking essentials. The Chicago Metallic Professional line of bakeware makes cooking and baking a delight. The non-stick surface easily releases each recipe and makes clean-up effortless. It’s the preferred choice of bakers who understand quality and design, but also want professional-grade durability.

AMAZON.COM
Regular muffin tins can't make a perfect popover--the classic American pastry that requires just the right heat circulation to inflate and pop over without overcrowding. Chicago Metallic has engineered this pan to ensure that every popover gets a big rise. Each 2-1/4-by-2-inch cup is suspended from crossbars and has an extra-wide lip so popovers can spread out and up. Properly puffed, popovers are a quick breakfast indulgence with butter and jam, or a savory surprise for dinner when stuffed with a mushroom filling. This pan is made from the same professional-quality steel and nonstick coating as Chicago Metallic's full line of bakeware, which is designed for the home cook who has high standards. --Lynne Sampson
feature_bullets: MULTIPLE BAKING USES: The Chicago Metallic Popover Pan can be used to bake traditional popovers, Yorkshire puddings, and can also be used to make traditional muffins.
SUPERIOR HEAT CONDUCTION AND EVEN BAKING: This pan is made from heavy-weight aluminized steel for superior heat conduction and even baking.
NON-STICK COATING FOR EASY RELEASE: Easy release, silicone based, non-stick coating for ease of baking and cleanup and is heat safe up to 450 degrees F (232 degrees C).
MEASUREMENTS: This pan bakes 12 airy popovers; each cup measures 2.25 inches by 2 inches; the total pan measures 16 inches by 10.8 inches by 2.3 inches
DISHWASHER SAFE: This pan is dishwasher safe, however hand-washing is recommended to extend the product life. Heavy duty construction
